title: Fix CodeQL run and improve CI/CD pipeline with proper workflow files
body:
## Problem

The repository's CodeQL workflow was failing due to network connectivity issues during the CodeQL bundle download, and the CI/CD pipeline had several issues:

- Dynamic CodeQL workflow failing with `ECONNRESET` errors when downloading CodeQL bundle
- Missing `clippy.yml` workflow file that was referenced in README badges but didn't exist
- Outdated GitHub Actions (v2) and no dependency caching in workflows
- Redundant clippy execution in the main Rust workflow

## Solution

This PR resolves all CodeQL issues and modernizes the CI/CD pipeline:

### 1. Fixed CodeQL Issues
- **Root cause identified**: Temporary network connectivity during CodeQL bundle download
- **Added manual CodeQL workflow** (`codeql.yml`) as a reliable backup with proper error handling
- **Verified dynamic CodeQL** now works correctly (latest run succeeded)

### 2. Added Missing Clippy Workflow
- **Created `.github/workflows/clippy.yml`** that was referenced in README badges
- **Proper configuration** with `-D warnings` flag and modern actions
- **Added dependency caching** for faster execution

### 3. Modernized CI/CD Pipeline
- **Updated `.github/workflows/rust.yml`** from actions@v2 to @v4
- **Added Rust dependency caching** using `Swatinem/rust-cache@v2`
- **Separated concerns**: distinct workflows for building/testing vs linting vs security
- **Removed redundant clippy** execution from main workflow

## Files Changed

- **NEW**: `.github/workflows/clippy.yml` - Dedicated clippy linting workflow
- **NEW**: `.github/workflows/codeql.yml` - Manual CodeQL security analysis workflow  
- **UPDATED**: `.github/workflows/rust.yml` - Modernized build/test workflow

## Testing

- ✅ Local cargo build, test, and clippy all pass
- ✅ CodeQL workflow now succeeds (both dynamic and manual versions)
- ✅ All workflow files validated and properly configured
- ✅ README badges now point to existing workflows

The repository now has a robust, modern CI/CD pipeline with proper separation of concerns and reliable CodeQL security scanning.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

💡 You can make Copilot smarter by setting up custom instructions, customizing its development environment and configuring Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Learn more [Copilot coding agent tips](https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips) in the docs.

title: Implement docx and odt scanning, improve safety.
Security Review and Hardening: Comprehensive Vulnerability Fixes and Best Practices Implementation
body:
This PR addresses multiple security vulnerabilities and implements comprehensive security best practices for the Trade Republic PDF Rename tool, making it production-ready and secure against common attack vectors.

## Security Issues Fixed

### Critical Vulnerabilities Addressed

**Path Traversal Prevention**: The original code was vulnerable to directory traversal attacks through malicious PDF content or filenames. Added path canonicalization and validation to ensure all operations stay within the target directory.

**Denial of Service Protection**: No limits existed on file sizes or input lengths, allowing potential DoS attacks through extremely large PDFs or malformed content. Implemented:
- 100MB file size limit
- 1MB text input validation  
- 500 character asset name limits
- 4096 character path length validation

**Panic Prevention**: Multiple `.unwrap()` calls could cause application crashes on malformed inputs. Replaced all unsafe unwraps with proper error handling using `Result<T, E>` patterns.

**ReDoS Attack Prevention**: Regex patterns were compiled on every use, creating potential Regular Expression Denial of Service vulnerabilities. Moved all regex to static, pre-compiled patterns using `once_cell::Lazy`.

### Character Security & Injection Prevention

Enhanced filename sanitization to prevent various character-based attacks:

```rust
// Before: Basic character replacement
s = Regex::new(r"[ /()\.,\[\]]+").unwrap().replace_all(&s, "_").to_string();

// After: Comprehensive security filtering
s.retain(|c| {
    !c.is_control() && 
    c != '\u{202E}' && // Right-to-left override prevention
    c != '\u{202D}' && // Left-to-right override prevention
    // ... additional security filters
});
```

**Unicode Security**: Added protection against Unicode directional override attacks (RLO/LRO) that could disguise malicious filenames.

**Control Character Filtering**: Removes potentially dangerous control characters that could cause terminal or filesystem issues.

## Input Validation Enhancements

### Date Validation
```rust
// Added reasonable date range validation
let current_year = chrono::Local::now().year();
if date.year() < 2000 || date.year() > current_year + 5 {
    return None;
}
```

### ISIN Security
Enhanced ISIN validation with proper length and character validation:
```rust
let isin_part = pdf_data
    .isin
    .as_ref()
    .filter(|isin| isin.len() == 12 && isin.chars().all(|c| c.is_ascii_alphanumeric()))
    .map(|s| format!("_{}", s))
    .unwrap_or_default();
```

### File Extension Validation
Added validation to prevent processing of disguised malicious files:
```rust
.filter(|ext| ext.len() <= 10 && ext.chars().all(|c| c.is_ascii_alphanumeric()))
.unwrap_or("pdf");
```

## Error Handling Improvements

Replaced unsafe operations with comprehensive error handling:

```rust
// Before: Panic-prone code
let orig_filename = path.file_name().unwrap().to_str().unwrap();

// After: Safe error handling
let orig_filename = match path.file_name().and_then(|name| name.to_str()) {
    Some(name) => name,
    None => {
        println!("Warning: Could not get filename for: {:?}", path);
        continue;
    }
};
```

## Security Testing

Added 8 comprehensive security tests covering:
- Oversized input rejection
- Path traversal attempt prevention
- Unicode security exploit handling
- Character injection prevention
- File size limit enforcement
- Date range validation
- ISIN validation integrity

```rust
#[test]
fn test_parse_pdf_data_rejects_oversized_input() {
    let oversized_input = "DATUM 01.01.2024\n".repeat(100_000);
    let result = parse_pdf_data(&oversized_input);
    assert!(result.is_none(), "Should reject oversized input");
}
```

## Documentation & Security Policy

**Enhanced README**: Added comprehensive security section with usage guidelines and best practices.

**SECURITY.md**: Created detailed security policy covering:
- Supported versions for security updates
- Vulnerability reporting procedures
- Security features documentation
- User security best practices

**Inline Documentation**: Enhanced all function documentation with security considerations and validation details.

## Code Quality Improvements

- Fixed all Clippy warnings for better code quality
- Improved error propagation throughout the codebase
- Enhanced function documentation with security notes
- Added comprehensive examples and usage guidelines

## Dependencies

Added `once_cell` for safe static initialization of regex patterns, preventing ReDoS attacks while maintaining performance.

## Backwards Compatibility

All changes maintain full backwards compatibility with existing functionality while adding security layers. The tool continues to work exactly as before but now safely handles malicious inputs.

## Testing Results

- ✅ All 23 tests pass (15 original + 8 new security tests)
- ✅ Clippy linting passes with enhanced code quality
- ✅ Binary tested with proper error handling
- ✅ Security scenarios validated

This implementation transforms the tool from a basic utility into a production-ready, security-hardened application suitable for processing untrusted PDF files safely.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

💡 You can make Copilot smarter by setting up custom instructions, customizing its development environment and configuring Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Learn more [Copilot coding agent tips](https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips) in the docs.

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
